creditline: Bequest of Rosalynd C. Pflaum in appreciation of MIA curator Richard Campbell's years of assistance
description: head and upper body of man with large nose; sketchy style; man's PL arm across his stomach with PL hand in LRC
image_copyright: © Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F Pro Litteris%2C Zurich
inscription:
Signature, Date and Inscription

LRC, in pencil: [for my beloved Rosalind / (illegible), Litho, 1965 / Oskar Kokoshka]
provenance: The artist to Rosalynd Pflaum (1917-2014), Wayzata, MN
signed: LRC, in the print: [OK]; see Inscription
text: The Austrian Expressionist Oskar Kokoschka published this impressive self-portrait in his 80th year. His likeness slowly emerges in the network of jagged, brutal black marks on the paper—the aging revolutionary artist remains defiant, albeit world-weary.
title: Self-Portrait
